meanings.definition: Apply a new coat of lacquer to (something).
meanings.sent1: She is relacquering the old table to make it shiny again.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter will relacquer the wooden chair to protect it from scratches.
meanings.sent3: After relacquering the dresser, it looked like new and sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent4: The artist relacquered the painting with care, preserving its beauty for years to come.
meanings.sent5: Relacquering the antique vase brought out its intricate details and rich colors.

meanings.definition: The action of applying a new coat of lacquer to something.
meanings.sent1: The relacquering of the cabinet was necessary to restore its glossy finish.
meanings.sent2: He learned about relacquering during his woodworking class.
meanings.sent3: The relacquering of the old violin made it look brand new and improved its sound.
meanings.sent4: The relacquering of the floors gave the room a fresh and clean appearance.
meanings.sent5: The relacquering process requires patience and attention to detail.
